    Fujita2023_analysis Introduction to PARAFAC modelling Shao2019_analysis vanderPloeg2024_analysis

    Export the PARAFAC model

    exportPARAFAC.Rd

    Currently only supports 3-mode models.

    Usage

    exportPARAFAC(
  model,
  dataset,
  prefix = "PARAFACmodel_",
  path = "./",
  saveRDS = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    model

    Model output from parafac().

    dataset

    A longitudinal microbiome dataset, ideally processed with processDataCube(), formatted as follows:

    data

    Array object of the data cube

    mode1

    Dataframe with all the subject metadata, ordered the same as the rows in the data cube.

    mode2

    Taxonomic classification of the microbiota, ordered the same as the columns in the data cube.

    mode3

    Dataframe with the time metadata, ordered the same as the third dimension in the array.

    prefix

    Prefix file name

    path

    Path to a folder

    saveRDS

    Save an RDS of the PARAFAC model object? (true/false, default=FALSE)

    Value

    Saves mode1, mode2, mode3, input data, modelled data, and data as modelled per component in .csv files.

    Examples

    library(multiway)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(ggplot2)
library(paramGUI)
library(pracma)
set.seed(0)

# Make PARAFAC model
processedFujita = processDataCube(Fujita2023, sparsityThreshold=0.99, centerMode=1, scaleMode=2)
model = parafac(processedFujita$data, nfac=2, nstart=1, verbose=FALSE)
if (FALSE) {
exportPARAFAC(model, processedFujita, prefix="Fujita_")
}
